author: Erica Corsano
title: Social Studies: Style + comfort is a luxury
text:
RIP pink velour tracksuit — thanks to brands like Kit and Ace, casual dressing can include luxury.
Owned by the Wilson family (of Lululemon fame) Canada’s Kit and Ace celebrated the opening of its Newbury Street store last night with a big, fat, bash featuring a performance by AlunaGeorge, the English EDM duo (“You Know You Like It”), and drinks and bites by the Event Society.
The company’s claim to fame is “Technical Cashmere,” a machine-washable fabric with added stretch.
A line snaked down Newbury to get in — here were some of the lucky 300 gadabouts who did: designer Chynna Pope , Kit and Ace founders Shannon and stepson JJ Wilson, shop director Lindsey Butler , stylin’ attorney Allison O’Neil , bag designer Gina DeWolfe , Nick and Amy Penna and Shaun O’Connor from Salon Capri, and artist Clint Baclawski , whose work is featured in the Newbury Street store.
